title: Behind Iran's brutal crackdown, rulers play for survival
subhead: After easing pressure on the population since last summer, Iran's rulers have unleashed a fierce crackdown in response to an unprecedented protest movement. Isolated by the weakening of its regional 'axis of resistance,' the regime appears to have turned to brute force as a survival strategy.

title: In Greenland, a European military mission of uncertain contours seeks to counter Trump
French government halts budget discussions to consider options
'The budget and the Mercosur deal: Two symptoms of France's political powerlessness'
subhead: The crisis engulfing the government at the start of 2026 is a result of the failed snap elections of 2024. Yet it is also symptomatic of an exhausted system, in which posturing has surpassed long-term political efforts, observes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: Istanbul's ultra-violent gangs tighten their grip on the city
subhead: In Turkey's major cities, criminal gangs made up of teenagers and young adults have grown rapidly in recent years, fueled by a boom in synthetic drug trafficking.

title: Benedictine nuns of Montmartre spent 40 years 'under duress,' report finds
subhead: An independent investigation, commissioned by the congregation of the iconic Paris neighborhood, reported that former prioress general Mother Marie-Agn√®s ruled through an atmosphere of 'terror and suspicion' up to her death in 2016. The control of food and body weight of the congregation's members was central to the superior's domination.

title: Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
subhead: The former head of artificial intelligence research at Meta explains his decision to start a new company focused on the physical world, citing strategic differences with the American tech giant and predicting a 'third AI revolution' in the coming years.

Bulgaria to hold snap elections after parties fail to form government
'India and Europe are discovering new geostrategic affinities, an example of realignment amid global chaos'
subhead: The warming of relations between Europe and the world's most populous country reflects a counter-strategy to the hostility of the Trump administration, writes Le Monde's columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhead: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.

title: 'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
subhead: As the president shows his eagerness to dismantle any form of checks and balances both within and beyond the US borders, the principles of law paradoxically endure, explains Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: President Trump, Greenland does not want to become American
2027 French presidential election: A real campaign is needed to slow the far right
